data.title: Operations Fellowship
data.meta_description: The UC Department of Emergency Medicine at the University of Cincinnati has been an independent academic unit within the College of Medicine since 1984. It is responsible for the medical direction of the University of Cincinnati Medical Center, Center for Emergency Care (CEC) and the Emergency Medicine Residency Training Program.  The UC Department of Emergency Medicine features the oldest residency training program in the United States and was founded in 1970. The UC Emergency Medicine department has enjoyed a reputation of excellence in the field for over 50 years and continues to attract top medical students. Nationally recognized faculty are leaders in clinical teaching and research.
data.text:
Clinical Operations and Administration Fellowship

Launch your career in Emergency Department leadership with our 2-year, mentored fellowship.

Gain unparalleled expertise in healthcare operations and administration at the University of Cincinnati Department of Emergency Medicineâ€™s Clinical Operations and Administration Fellowship. This immersive program equips you with the skills and knowledge to become a transformative leader in Emergency Medicine.

Master the essentials: Develop in-depth understanding of departmental operations, quality improvement, patient safety, financial management, and research methodology.

Earn an MBA: Gain valuable business acumen through the prestigious Lindner College of Business at UC.

Refine your clinical leadership: Practice as an attending across multiple clinical sites, honing your decision-making and communication skills.

Conduct impactful research: Contribute to groundbreaking projects and publish your findings, becoming a respected leader in the field.

Join a supportive community: Learn from renowned faculty, collaborate with peers, and forge lasting connections within the EM community.

Graduate with the confidence and qualifications to:
